required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Olanzapine in the Extended Treatment for Manic or Mixed Episode of Bipolar I Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Olanzapine in the Extended Treatment for Manic or Mixed Episode of Bipolar I Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The efficacy and safety of the extended treatment to patients with most recent episode manic or mixed who completed previous double blind study (F1D-JE-BMAC [Study BMAC]) will be examined.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Endpoint in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Total Scores - Olanzapine Monotherapy Arm Only
primary_outcome.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60. The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Response of Manic Symptoms - Olanzapine Monotherapy Arm Only
primary_outcome.description: Defined by a 50% or more reduction in YMRS total score from baseline in Study BMAC to endpoint. The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60. The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Remission of Mania - Olanzapine Monotherapy Arm Only
primary_outcome.description: Remission of Mania was defined as a YMRS total score of less than or equal to 12 at endpoint. The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60. The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Relapse of Manic Symptoms - Olanzapine Monotherapy Arm Only
primary_outcome.description: Patients achieved remission in Study BMAC (defined as YMRS total score <=12 and HAMD-17 total score <=7) and obtained YMRS total score of >=15 at any time during Study BMEX. The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60. The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Endpoint on the YMRS Total Score - Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer Only
secondary_outcome.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impressions - Bipolar Version, Severity of Illness (CGI-BP) Overall, Visit Data
secondary_outcome.description: Measures severity of the patient's overall severity of bipolar symptoms (1=normal, not at all ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced Switch to Symptomatic Depression as Measured by the Hamilton Depression Scale - 17 Item Version (HAMD-17)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of depressive symptoms was defined as a score of equal to or more than 13 points on the HAMD-17. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked) or a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Relapse of Depressive Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed were participants meeting remission criteria for bipolar disorder in Study BMAC and have a HAMD-17 total score greater than or equal to 13 at any time. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked) or a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced Remission of Bipolar Disorder
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who had equal to or less than 12 points in YMRS total score and equal to or less than 7 points in HAMD-17 total score at 18 weeks. YMRS: 11-item scale, measures the severity of manic episodes. 4 items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total: 0 to 60. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale or a 5-point scale. HAMD-17 total score: 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Positive Scores - Visit Data
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses positive symptoms associated with schizophrenia. 7 items make up the Positive scale. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Total Positive Subscale scores range from 7 to 49. For the analysis, the score was converted to 0 to 6 for each item range; hence, the total score ranges from 0 to 42.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Switched to Syndromic Depression
secondary_outcome.description: As defined as a shift from a Manic Episode at baseline to a Major Depressive Episode, at any post baseline visit, based on Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition Text Revision.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Change From Baseline to Endpoint on the Drug Induced Extra-Pyramidal Symptoms Scale (DIEPSS) - Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: A scale used to assess the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items for the assessment of individual symptoms are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5; akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia are assessed by the points given to the corresponding items.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Parkinsonism Based on DIEPSS Scores
secondary_outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5 (total score of 0 to 20). Treatment-emergent parkinsonism was defined as a score of equal or greater than 3 on 1 item, equal or greater than 2 on 2 items, or an increase of equal or greater than 3 from baseline on the parkinsonism total.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Akathisia Based on DIEPSS Scores
secondary_outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Treatment-emergent akathisia was defined as a score of equal or more than 2 or an increase of equal or more than 2 points from baseline on the akathisia item (total score possible 0 to 4 points).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Dystonia Based on DIEPSS Scores
secondary_outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Treatment-emergent dystonia was defined as a score equal or more than 2 or an increase of equal or more than 2 points from baseline on the dystonia item (total score possible 0 to 4 points).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Dyskenisia Based on DIEPSS Scores
secondary_outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Treatment-emergent dyskenisia was defined as a score of equal or more than 2 or an increase of equal to or more than 2 points from baseline on the dyskenisia item (total score possible 0 to 4 points).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Laboratory Analytes
secondary_outcome.description: Triglycerides: high limit equal to or more than 500 milligram/deciliter (mg/dL); Glucose (non-fasting): low limit 2.4975 mmol/liter (L); high limit 13.875 mmol/L; Glucose (fasting): low limit 2.4975 mmol/L; high limit 6.993 mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Low systolic blood pressure (SBP): <=90 millimeter mercury (mmHg) and decrease of >=20 mmHg; High SBP: >=180 mmHg and increase of >=20 mmHg; Low diastolic blood pressure (DBP): <=50 mmHg and decrease of >=15 mmHg; High DBP: >=105 mmHg and increase of >=15 mmHg; Low pulse: <50 beats per minute (bpm) and decrease of >=15 bpm; High pulse: >120 bpm and an increase of >=15 bpm; Low weight: decrease of >=7%; High weight: increase of >=7%;

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Electrocardiograms - High Fridericia Corrected QT Interval (QTcF)
secondary_outcome.description: High QTcF: more than or equal to 450 milliseconds (msec) for males; more than or equal to 470 milliseconds (msec) for females

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Abnormal, High, or Low Laboratory Values
secondary_outcome.description: High density lipoprotein: males low 40 milligram/deciliter (mg/dL), high 80 mg/dL; females low 40 mg/dL, high 90 mg/dL. Low density lipoprotein (LDL): males and females low 70 mg/dL, high 139 mg/dL. Hemoglobin A1C (HBA1C): males and females low 4.3%, high 5.8%.

clinical_study.condition: Manic or Mixed Episode Associated With Bipolar I Disorder

arm_group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanzapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

intervention.description: Dose adjusted according to local package insert
Dose adjusted according to local package insert
Dose adjusted according to local package insert

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in and completed Study BMAC (NCT00129220), or those who discontinued Study BMAC at Visit 4 or Visit 5 due to lack of efficacy and for whom the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) total score at the time of discontinuation was not lower than that at baseline of Study BMAC
- Are diagnosed as "294.4x Bipolar I Disorder, Most Recent Episode Manic" or "296.6x Bipolar I Disorder, Most Recent Episode Mixed," as determined by the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus
- Significant protocol deviation in Study BMAC
- The actual date of the final visit of Study BMAC is 4 days or more later than the scheduled date of first visit in Study BMEX

group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Current Episode - Mixed or Manic
measure.description: Description of the bipolar episode the participant experienced when enrolling into the study.

measure.title: Current Episode - Psychotic or Nonpsychotic
measure.description: Description of the bipolar episode the participant experienced when enrolling into the study.

measure.title: Rapid Cyclers
measure.description: A rapid cycler is defined as a person who experiences four or more mood swings or episodes in a twelve-month period.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impressions - Bipolar Version, Severity of Illness (CGI-BP) overall
measure.description: Measures severity of the patient's overall severity of bipolar symptoms (1=normal, not at all ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients).

measure.title: Hamilton Depression Scale - 17 item version (HAMD-17) Total Score
measure.description: The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked) or a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

measure.title: Length of Current Episode
Mean Age at Onset of Illness
Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Total Score
measure.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Endpoint in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Total Scores - Olanzapine Monotherapy Arm Only
outcome.description: The YMRS is an 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes. Four items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total score ranges from 0 to 60. The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm.
outcome.population: The primary objective was only interested in the effects in the olanzapine monotherapy arm, thus the results for the olanzapine + mood stabilizer arm are presented as secondary outcomes. Analyzed were all participants in the olanzapine monotherapy arm who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked) or a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants in the olanzapine monotherapy group who had 12 points or less in the YMRS total score and 7 points or less in the HAMD-17 total score at baseline.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanzapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Relapse of Depressive Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed were participants meeting remission criteria for bipolar disorder in Study BMAC and have a HAMD-17 total score greater than or equal to 13 at any time. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked) or a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
measure.population: Analyzed were all participants in the olanzapine monotherapy group who had 12 points or less in the YMRS total score and 7 points or less in the HAMD-17 total score at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Remission of Bipolar Disorder
outcome.description: Participants who had equal to or less than 12 points in YMRS total score and equal to or less than 7 points in HAMD-17 total score at 18 weeks. YMRS: 11-item scale, measures the severity of manic episodes. 4 items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total: 0 to 60. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale or a 5-point scale. HAMD-17 total score: 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Remission of Bipolar Disorder
measure.description: Participants who had equal to or less than 12 points in YMRS total score and equal to or less than 7 points in HAMD-17 total score at 18 weeks. YMRS: 11-item scale, measures the severity of manic episodes. 4 items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items are rated from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). The YMRS total: 0 to 60. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using a 3-point scale or a 5-point scale. HAMD-17 total score: 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
measure.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Positive Scores - Visit Data
outcome.description: Assesses positive symptoms associated with schizophrenia. 7 items make up the Positive scale. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Total Positive Subscale scores range from 7 to 49. For the analysis, the score was converted to 0 to 6 for each item range; hence, the total score ranges from 0 to 42.
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Positive Scores - Visit Data
measure.description: Assesses positive symptoms associated with schizophrenia. 7 items make up the Positive scale. Each item is rated on a scale from 1 (symptom not present) to 7 (symptoms extremely severe). Total Positive Subscale scores range from 7 to 49. For the analysis, the score was converted to 0 to 6 for each item range; hence, the total score ranges from 0 to 42.
measure.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Switched to Syndromic Depression
outcome.description: As defined as a shift from a Manic Episode at baseline to a Major Depressive Episode, at any post baseline visit, based on Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition Text Revision.
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had a manic episode at baseline.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Switched to Syndromic Depression
measure.description: As defined as a shift from a Manic Episode at baseline to a Major Depressive Episode, at any post baseline visit, based on Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition Text Revision.
measure.population: Analyzed were all participants who had a manic episode at baseline.

outcome.title: Maximum Change From Baseline to Endpoint on the Drug Induced Extra-Pyramidal Symptoms Scale (DIEPSS) - Total Score
outcome.description: A scale used to assess the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items for the assessment of individual symptoms are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5; akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia are assessed by the points given to the corresponding items.
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Maximum Change From Baseline to Endpoint on the Drug Induced Extra-Pyramidal Symptoms Scale (DIEPSS) - Total Score
measure.description: A scale used to assess the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items for the assessment of individual symptoms are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5; akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia are assessed by the points given to the corresponding items.
measure.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

class.title: Maximum Change from baseline to endpoint

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Parkinsonism Based on DIEPSS Scores
outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5 (total score of 0 to 20). Treatment-emergent parkinsonism was defined as a score of equal or greater than 3 on 1 item, equal or greater than 2 on 2 items, or an increase of equal or greater than 3 from baseline on the parkinsonism total.
outcome.population: Included were all participants who did not have an abnormal value at baseline.

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

group.title: Olanzapine + Mood Stabilizer
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who discontinued at Visit 4 or 5. Patients received an initial dose of olanzapine 10 mg for 1 week and subsequent doses of olanzapine 5-20 mg for 17 weeks. Patients received one (1) mood stabilizer (lithium, valproate or carbamazepine) for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Parkinsonism Based on DIEPSS Scores
measure.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). Parkinsonism is assessed by the total points of items 1 to 5 (total score of 0 to 20). Treatment-emergent parkinsonism was defined as a score of equal or greater than 3 on 1 item, equal or greater than 2 on 2 items, or an increase of equal or greater than 3 from baseline on the parkinsonism total.
measure.population: Included were all participants who did not have an abnormal value at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Akathisia Based on DIEPSS Scores
outcome.description: DIEPSS assesses the extrapyramidal symptoms attributable to antipsychotics. Consists of 9 items (8 to assess individual symptoms and 1 to assess global severity). Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. Treatment-emergent akathisia was defined as a score of equal or more than 2 or an increase of equal or more than 2 points from baseline on the akathisia item (total score possible 0 to 4 points).
outcome.population: Included were all participants who did not have an abnormal value at baseline.

Each item is assessed from 0 (none, normal) to 4 (severe). The total points of 8 items are defined as DIEPSS total (0 to 32 points). The items are classified into 4 categories of parkinsonism, akathisia, dystonia and dyskinesia. outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Laboratory Analytes
outcome.description: Triglycerides: high limit equal to or more than 500 milligram/deciliter (mg/dL); Glucose (non-fasting): low limit 2.4975 mmol/liter (L); high limit 13.875 mmol/L; Glucose (fasting): low limit 2.4975 mmol/L; high limit 6.993 mmol/L.
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants without an abnormal value in the direction at baseline (for example, participants with an abnormally low value at baseline who experienced an abnormally low value at any time post baseline were not included, but were included if they experienced an abnormally high value at any time post baseline).

group.title: Olanzapine Monotherapy
group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanzapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

measure.population: Analyzed were all participants without an abnormal value in the direction at baseline (for example, participants with an abnormally low value at baseline who experienced an abnormally low value at any time post baseline were not included, but were included if they experienced an abnormally high value at any time post baseline).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Weight
outcome.description: Low systolic blood pressure (SBP): <=90 millimeter mercury (mmHg) and decrease of >=20 mmHg; High SBP: >=180 mmHg and increase of >=20 mmHg; Low diastolic blood pressure (DBP): <=50 mmHg and decrease of >=15 mmHg; High DBP: >=105 mmHg and increase of >=15 mmHg; Low pulse: <50 beats per minute (bpm) and decrease of >=15 bpm; High pulse: >120 bpm and an increase of >=15 bpm; Low weight: decrease of >=7%; High weight: increase of >=7%;
outcome.population: Analyzed were all study participants.

group.description: Olanzapine extension for Study BMAC patients who completed Visit 8. Patients received olanzapine 5-20 mg for 18 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs and Weight
measure.description: Low systolic blood pressure (SBP): <=90 millimeter mercury (mmHg) and decrease of >=20 mmHg; High SBP: >=180 mmHg and increase of >=20 mmHg; Low diastolic blood pressure (DBP): <=50 mmHg and decrease of >=15 mmHg; High DBP: >=105 mmHg and increase of >=15 mmHg; Low pulse: <50 beats per minute (bpm) and decrease of >=15 bpm; High pulse: >120 bpm and an increase of >=15 bpm; Low weight: decrease of >=7%; High weight: increase of >=7%;
measure.population: Analyzed were all study participants.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Changes in Electrocardiograms - High Fridericia Corrected QT Interval (QTcF)
outcome.description: High QTcF: more than or equal to 450 milliseconds (msec) for males; more than or equal to 470 milliseconds (msec) for females
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements and no abnormal values in the direction at baseline (e.g. participants with an abnormally low value for a given parameter at baseline who showed an abnormally low value for the same parameter at a later visit were not included). Last observation carried forward.

measure.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements and no abnormal values in the direction at baseline (e.g. participants with an abnormally low value for a given parameter at baseline who showed an abnormally low value for the same parameter at a later visit were not included). Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Abnormal, High, or Low Laboratory Values
outcome.description: High density lipoprotein: males low 40 milligram/deciliter (mg/dL), high 80 mg/dL; females low 40 mg/dL, high 90 mg/dL. Low density lipoprotein (LDL): males and females low 70 mg/dL, high 139 mg/dL. Hemoglobin A1C (HBA1C): males and females low 4.3%, high 5.8%.
outcome.population: Analyzed were all participants who had baseline and post-baseline measurements. Last observation carried forward.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
